title: SB 1186
content:
The people of the State of California enact the following. The sum of $647,443.32 is appropriated to the Executive Officer of the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board for payment of accepted claims from specified funds. The schedule for payment includes amounts from various funds such as the General Fund and specific budget programs. Total appropriations for various programs under different funds from the Budget Act of 2016 are as follows:
- Fund: Item 2740-001-0044, Program 2130 - $966.22
- Fund: Item 4260-101-0001, Program 3960022 - $2,028.06
- Fund: Item 5180-111-0001, Program 4275010 - $15,567.57
- Fund: Item 7100-001-0185, Program 5930 - $22,537.91 The Controller is required to transfer surcharges and fees from specified Budget Act items to a designated section. The transferred amount should not exceed the total per claim filing fee and surcharge authorized by the Government Code. The Controller will transfer an amount not exceeding the total per claim filing fee and surcharge authorized by the Government Code to support board reimbursements. The board must report the recovered amounts to the Department of Finance within 90 days of the enactment of this act. The General Fund appropriates $581,600 to pay Obie Steven Anthony III's claim and $653,600 to pay John Smith's claim through the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board. The General Fund appropriates $564,100 to pay Michael Smith's claim and $512,600 to pay Timothy Gantt's claim through the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board. The General Fund appropriates $654,500 for Marco Milla's claim and $762,440 for Larry Pohlschneider's claim through the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board. The General Fund appropriates $936,880 to the Executive Officer of the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board for Luther Ed Jones, Jr.'s claim. This act is an urgency statute to quickly address claims against the state.
